6747|Sweet Corn Tamale Cakes|"Sweet Corn Tamale CakesSALSA VERDE
fresh choppedPrepare SALSA VERDE by combining all ingredients in a food processor on high speed. Cover and chill.
Prepare TOMATO SALSA by combining all ingredients in a small bowl. Cover and chill.
Prepare SOUTHWESTERN SAUCE by combining all ingredients is a small bowl. Cover and chill.
For the TAMALE CAKES coarsely puree 1 cup of the frozen corn in a food processor.
Combine pureed corn with softened butter
Blend well with electric mixer until smooth.
Add masa and flour and blend well.
Mix in the remaining 1/2 cup of frozen corn by hand.
Measure 1/2 cup portions and form into 3-inch patties.
arrange patties on a baking sheet and bake 25 to 30 minutes
or until the cakes are browned on the bottom.
Carefully flip cakes with a spatula and bake for an additional 5 to 7 minutes or until other side is browned.
spoon some Salsa Verde onto a platter.
Coat the entire plate with about 1/4 in of the salsa.
Arrange the Tamale Cakes on the Salsa Verde.
Spoon a dollop of sour cream on to each cake."||2663.0||food_7580|"SALSA VERDE

6850|Diane'S Best Gazpacho -- Ever!|"Diane'S Best Gazpacho -- Ever!Gazpacho
any variety (it's especially great with a variety of heirloom tomatoes)
1/2 to 1 teaspoons crushed red pepper flakes (to taste)

2 tablespoons Spanish extra-virgin olive oilPrep the Vegetables\r\nCore the larger tomatoes and chop roughly into quarters; chop cherry or grape tomatoes in half. Place in a large bowl. Peel the cucumber
cut into large chunks and add to the bowl. Cut the onion and green pepper into large pieces and place in the bowl. Add the garlic and the Kosher salt. If you like your food on the spicy side
chop and add a jalapeno pepper here
too. Toss the mixture to combine well. Pour the mixture into a strainer and place a bowl under the strainer to collect the juices. Let sit for 30 to 60 minutes.
Process the Soup\r\nAfter the vegetables have drained for at least 30 minutes
and add the torn bread to the strained liquid until soaked. Add the bread and any remaining liquid to the blender
add the sherry vinegar and blend until the mixture becomes a thick
beautiful pink liquid. Taste for acidity; this will vary with the sweetness and types of tomatoes used. If it's not balanced enough
add a little more vinegar. Add the red pepper flakes and then the olive oil
blending to emulsify each time. Chill for at least 30 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Prepare the Garnish\r\nDice the garnish vegetables into small pieces and set aside. In a small pan
heat the olive oil over a medium-high flame and fry the bread pieces until golden
about 2 minutes. Cool and set aside.
pour chilled gazpacho in serving bowls and pass the garnishes and croutons."||2139.0||food_7683|"Gazpacho
any variety (it's especially great with a variety of heirloom tomatoes)

6943|Buffalo Chicken Beer Cheese Soup|"Buffalo Chicken Beer Cheese Soup2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
1/4 cups Cayenne Pepper Sauce (like Frank's - More Or Less To Taste)
1-3/4 cup Shredded Sharp White Cheddar Cheese
Frank's Red Hot Sauce (for Toppings)In a large Dutch oven
heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and season with salt and black pepper. Cook for 5-6 minutes or until tender. Add the garlic and cook for another minute
or until fragrant. Add the beer. Bring to a boil and then lower to a simmer. Simmer for about 15 minutes or until the beer is substantially reduced.
Add the chicken broth. Using an immersion blender
blend the mixture until completely smooth. Alternately
you can use a regular blender if you don't have an immersion blender on hand. If you do this
make sure to blend in small batches and allow space for the hot soup to expand in the blender.
Bring the soup to a boil and then lower to a simmer. Simmer for an additional 15 minutes.

whisk together the flour and just enough milk to create a paste (about 1/4-1/3 of a cup). Whisk the flour into the soup and then add the remaining milk. Continue to simmer the soup for another 15 minutes
whisking frequently until the soup has thickened slightly. Stir in the hot sauce. Cook for an additional 3 minutes and then remove from heat.
In 1/2 cup increments add the cheddar cheese and blue cheese crumbles to the soup
stirring and melting the cheeses completely before adding the next addition. It's OK if a few chunks of blue cheese remain. Stir in the shredded chicken breast.
blue cheese and a drizzle of hot sauce. Enjoy!"||2371.0|Milk|food_7776|"2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
